intro: Vincetoxicum membranaceum, commonly known as the narrowleaf thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces elliptical, dark green leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its fruit is a spiny capsule that contains numerous small, brown seeds. Vincetoxicum membranaceum is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, thriving in partial to full shade.
